intro: Pleroma minus, commonly known as the small pleioma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Pleroma minus is often found in rocky or limestone habitats, where it forms compact, low-growing clumps. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plant collections.
